question.questionText: Which of the following AWS services can be used to serve large amounts of online video content with the lowest possible latency? (Select TWO)
question.explanation: The correct answers are: Amazon S3. and Amazom CloudFront.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which design principles relate to performance efficiency in AWS? (Choose TWO)
options: Build multi-region architectures to better serve global customers.
Implement strong Identity and Access controls.
question.explanation: The correct answers are: Build multi-region architectures to better serve global customers. and Use serverless architectures.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: What is a value proposition of the AWS Cloud?
options: AWS is responsible for security in the AWS Cloud.
AWS manages user applications in the AWS Cloud.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: No long-term contract is required.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: A company is seeking to better secure its AWS account from unauthorized access. Which of the below options can the customer use to achieve this goal?
options: Restrict any API call made through SDKs or CLI.
Create one IAM account for each department in the company (Development, QA, Production), and share it across all staff in that department.
Require Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for all IAM User access.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Require Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for all IAM User access.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which service can be used to monitor and receive alerts for AWS account root user AWS Management Console sign-in events?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Amazon CloudWatch. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/mt/monitor-and-notify-on-aws-account-root-user-activity/

question.questionText: Which AWS service can be used to route end users to the nearest AWS Region to reduce latency?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Amazon Route 53.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: If each department within a company has its own AWS account, what is one way to enable consolidated billing?
options: Use AWS Budgets on each account to pay only to budget.
Contact AWS Support for a monthly bill.
Create an AWS Organization from the payer account and invite the other accounts to join.
Put all invoices into one Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket, load data into Amazon Redshift, and then run a billing report.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Create an AWS Organization from the payer account and invite the other accounts to join.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/consolidated-billing.html

question.questionText:
An administrator needs to rapidly deploy a popular IT solution and start using it immediately.
Where can the administrator find assistance?
question.explanation:
- Quick Starts are built by AWS solutions architects and partners to help you deploy popular technologies on AWS, based on AWS best practices for security and high availability.
    - These accelerators reduce hundreds of manual procedures into just a few steps, so you can build your production environment quickly and start using it immediately.

    Reference:

question.questionText: What does Amazon Elastic Beanstalk provide?
options: A PaaS solution to automate application deployment.
A compute engine for Amazon ECS.
A scalable file storage solution for use with AWS and on-premises servers.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: A PaaS solution to automate application deployment.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model adjusts based on supply and demand of EC2 instances?
question.explanation:
- In the new model, the Spot prices are more predictable, updated less frequently, and are determined by supply and demand for Amazon EC2 spare capacity, not bid prices.

    Reference:

question.questionText: A solution that is able to support growth in users, traffic, or data size with no drop in performance aligns with which cloud architecture principle?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Implement elasticity. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://d1.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/AWS_Cloud_Best_Practices.pdf

question.questionText: Which AWS IAM feature allows developers to access AWS services through the AWS CLI?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Access keys.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which of the following is an important architectural design principle when designing cloud applications?
question.explanation:
- Data Center resilience is practiced through Availability Zones across data centers that reduce the impact of failures.
    - Fault isolation improvement can be made to traditional horizontal scaling by sharding (a method of grouping instances into groups called shards, instead of sending the traffic from all users to every node like in the traditional IT structure.)

    Reference:

question.questionText: According to the AWS Shared responsibility model, which of the following are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose TWO)
options: Managing environmental events of AWS data centers.
Protecting the confidentiality of data in transit in Amazon S3.
Controlling physical access to AWS Regions.
Ensuring that the underlying EC2 host is configured properly.
Patching applications installed on Amazon EC2.
question.explanation: The correct answers are: Protecting the confidentiality of data in transit in Amazon S3. and Patching applications installed on Amazon EC2.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: What is AWS Trusted Advisor?
options: It is an AWS staff member who provides recommendations and best practices on how to use AWS.
It is a network of AWS partners who provide recommendations and best practices on how to use AWS.
It is an online tool with a set of automated checks that provides recommendations on cost optimization, performance, and security.
It is another name for AWS Technical Account Managers who provide recommendations on cost optimization, performance, and security.
question.explanation:
- AWS Trusted Advisor is an online tool that provides you real time guidance to help you provision your resources following AWS best practices.
    - Whether establishing new workflows, developing applications, or as part of ongoing improvement, take advantage of the recommendations provided by Trusted Advisor on a regular basis to help keep your solutions provisioned optimally.

    Reference:

This service is part of the security, identity, and compliance category and is essential for understanding AWS cloud services in the security domain.

question.explanation: IAM is an AWS service that helps you helps users securely control access to AWS resources. This service is part of the security, identity, and compliance category and is essential for understanding AWS cloud services in the security domain.

question.questionText: Which AWS service should you use to manage sign-in security for workforce identities?
question.explanation: IAM Identity Center is an AWS service that helps you manage sign-in security for workforce identities. This service is part of the security, identity, and compliance category and is essential for understanding AWS cloud services in the security domain.

question.questionText:
A company is building an application that requires the ability to send, store, and receive messages between application components. The company has another requirement to process messages in first-in, first-out (FIFO) order.
Which AWS service should the company use?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS). For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/sqs/faqs/

question.questionText: To app testing for Android, iOS, and web apps, which AWS service would you use?
question.explanation: AWS Device Farm is an AWS service that helps you app testing for Android, iOS, and web apps. This service is part of the frontend web and mobile category and is essential for understanding AWS cloud services in the technology domain.

question.questionText: Which architectural principle is used when deploying an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance in Multiple Availability Zone mode?
options: Automate everything that can be automated.
question.explanation:
- Amazon RDS Multi-AZ deployments provide enhanced availability and durability for Database (DB) Instances, making them a natural fit for production database workloads.
    - When you provision a Multi-AZ DB Instance, Amazon RDS automatically creates a primary DB Instance and synchronously replicates the data to a standby instance in a different Availability Zone (AZ).
    - Each AZ runs on its own physically distinct, independent infrastructure, and is engineered to be highly reliable.
    - In case of an infrastructure failure, Amazon RDS performs an automatic failover to the standby (or to a read replica in the case of Amazon Aurora), so that you can resume database operations as soon as the failover is complete.
    - Since the endpoint for your DB Instance remains the same after a failover, your application can resume database operation without the need for manual administrative intervention.

    Reference:

question.questionText:
A user has a stateful workload that will run on Amazon EC2 for the next 3 years.
What is the MOST cost-effective pricing model for this workload?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Reserved Instances. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: What is the recommended storage option when hosting an often-changing database on an Amazon EC2 instance?
options: You can't run a database inside an Amazon EC2 instance.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Amazon EBS.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which of the following AWS Cloud services can be used to run a customer-managed relational database?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Amazon EC2.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: What is Amazon SNS?
options: Build and run applications that use Apache Kafka to process streaming data
Provides message delivery from publishers to subscribers
Collect, process, and analyze video streams and data streams in near real time
Analyze data directly in Amazon S3 by using standard SQL
question.explanation: Amazon SNS is an AWS service that helps you provides message delivery from publishers to subscribers. This service falls under the application integration category and is commonly used in cloud architecture for connecting and coordinating application components.

question.questionText:
A Cloud Practitioner is asked how to estimate the cost of using a new application on AWS.
What is the MOST appropriate response?
options: Inform the user that AWS pricing allows for on-demand pricing.
Direct the user to the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator for an estimate.
Use Amazon QuickSight to analyze current spending on-premises.
Use Amazon AppStream 2.0 for real-time pricing analytics.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Direct the user to the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator for an estimate.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/estimating-aws-resource-costs/

question.questionText: Which AWS service provides alerts when an AWS event may impact a company’s AWS resources?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: AWS Personal Health Dashboard.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which AWS service or feature allows the user to manage cross-region application traffic?

question.questionText: What are the advantages of Reserved Instances? (Choose two.)
options: They provide a discount over on-demand pricing.
They provide access to additional instance types.
Customers can upgrade instances as new types become available.
Customers can reserve capacity in an Availability Zone.
question.explanation: The correct answers are: They provide a discount over on-demand pricing. and Customers can reserve capacity in an Availability Zone. and Customers can reserve capacity in an Availability Zone.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-ri-basics/

question.questionText: Which AWS service allows you to build a data warehouse in the cloud?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Amazon Redshift.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which of the following is an available option when purchasing Amazon EC2 instances?
options: The ability to bid to get the lowest possible prices.
The ability to register EC2 instances to get volume discounts on every hour the instances are running.
The ability to buy Dedicated Instances for up to 90% discount.
The ability to pay upfront to get lower hourly costs.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: The ability to pay upfront to get lower hourly costs.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: The principle “design for failure and nothing will fail” is very important when designing your AWS Cloud architecture. Which of the following would help adhere to this principle? (Choose TWO)
question.explanation: The correct answers are: Availability Zones. and Elastic Load Balancing.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Engineers are wasting a lot of time and effort managing batch computing software in traditional data centers. Which of the following AWS services allows them to easily run thousands of batch computing jobs?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: AWS Batch.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Why is AWS more economical than traditional data centers for applications with varying compute workloads?
options: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) costs are billed on a monthly basis.
Customers retain full administrative access to their Amazon EC2 instances.
Amazon EC2 instances can be launched on-demand when needed.
Customers can permanently run enough instances to handle peak workloads.
question.explanation:
- The ability to launch instances on-demand when needed allows customers launch and terminate instances in response to a varying workload.
    - This is a more economical practice than purchasing enough on-premises servers to handle the peak load.

question.questionText: A company needs to monitors applications to automatically scale resources dynamically by adjusting capacity based on defined thresholds. Which AWS service would be the BEST fit?
question.explanation: AWS Auto Scaling is an AWS service that helps you monitors applications to automatically scale resources dynamically by adjusting capacity based on defined thresholds. This service is part of the management and governance category and is essential for understanding AWS cloud services in the cloud-concepts domain.

question.questionText: How can AWS customers track and avoid over-spending on underutilized reserved instances?
options: Customers can add all AWS accounts to an AWS Organization, enable Consolidated Billing, and turn off Reserved Instance sharing.
Customers can use Amazon Neptune to track and analyze their usage patterns, detect underutilized reserved instances, and then sell them on the Amazon EC2 Reserved Instance Marketplace.
Customers can use the AWS Budgets service to track the reserved instances usage and set up alert notifications when their utilization drops below the threshold that they define.
Customers can use Amazon CloudTrail to automatically check for unused reservations and get recommendations to reduce their bill.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Customers can use the AWS Budgets service to track the reserved instances usage and set up alert notifications when their utilization drops below the threshold that they define.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which AWS service should be used for long-term, low-cost storage of data backups?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Amazon Glacier.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: What is the lowest-cost, durable storage option for retaining database backups for immediate retrieval?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Amazon S3.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: How does AWS charge for AWS Lambda?
options: Users bid on the maximum price they are willing to pay per hour.
Users choose a 1-, 3- or 5-year upfront payment term.
Users pay for the required permanent storage on a file system or in a database.
Users pay based on the number of requests and consumed compute resources.
question.explanation:
- AWS Lambda is charging its users by the number of requests for their functions and by the duration, which is the time the code needs to execute.
    - When code starts running in response to an event, AWS Lambda counts a request.
    - It will charge the total number of requests across all of the functions used.
    - Duration is calculated by the time when your code started executing until it returns or until it is terminated, rounded up near to 100ms.
    - The AWS Lambda pricing depends on the amount of memory that the user used to allocate to the function.

    Reference:

question.questionText: What is the MINIMUM AWS Support plan level that will provide users with access to the AWS Support API?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Business. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

question.questionText: Which of the following services have Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) mitigation features? (Select TWO)
question.explanation: The correct answers are: AWS WAF. and Amazon CloudFront.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: A solutions architect needs to connect and process messages between IoT devices and IoT services. Which service should they recommend?
question.explanation: AWS IoT Core is an AWS service that helps you connect and process messages between IoT devices and IoT services. This service is part of the frontend web and mobile category and is essential for understanding AWS cloud services in the technology domain.

question.questionText: Sarah has deployed an application in the Northern California (us-west-1) region. After examining the application’s traffic, she notices that about 30% of the traffic is coming from Asia. What can she do to reduce latency for the users in Asia?
options: Replicate the current resources across multiple Availability Zones within the same region.
Migrate the application to a hosting provider in Asia.
Create a CDN using CloudFront, so that content is cached at Edge Locations close to and in Asia.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Create a CDN using CloudFront, so that content is cached at Edge Locations close to and in Asia.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which of the following aspects of security are managed by AWS? (Choose TWO)
question.explanation: The correct answers are: Hardware patching. and Securing global physical infrastructure.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: What is AWS Application Migration Service?
options: Provides scalable computing capacity in the AWS Cloud
Create and manage software development projects by integrating AWS services in the project development toolchain
Automatically extract text, handwriting, and data from scanned documents
Automated lift-and-shift (rehost) solution for migrations to AWS
question.explanation: AWS Application Migration Service is an AWS service that helps you automated lift-and-shift (rehost) solution for migrations to AWS. This service is part of the migration and transfer category and is essential for understanding AWS cloud services in the technology domain.

question.questionText: What is the benefit of using AWS managed services, such as Amazon ElastiCache and Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)?
options: They require the customer to monitor and replace failing instances.
They have better performance than customer-managed services.
They simplify patching and updating underlying OSs.
They do not require the customer to optimize instance type or size selections.
question.explanation:
- AWS Managed Services takes care of all of your patching and backup activities to help keep your resources current and secure. When updates or patches are released by OS vendors, AWS Managed Services applies them in a timely and consistent manner to minimize the impact on your business
      - Critical security patches are applied immediately, while others are applied based on the patch schedule you request. Backups of Stacks are automated using Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) and RDS snapshots, and can be restored in the event of a failure or outage, ensuring business continuity

question.questionText: Which disaster recovery scenario offers the lowest probability of down time?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Multi-site active-active.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

A user needs to automatically discover, classify, and protect sensitive data stored in Amazon S3.

question.questionText: Which Amazon RDS feature can be used to achieve high availability?
question.explanation:
- Amazon RDS provides high availability and failover support for DB instances using Multi-AZ deployments.
    - Amazon RDS uses several different technologies to provide failover support.
    - Multi-AZ deployments for Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL, and MariaDB DB instances use Amazon's failover technology.
    - SQL Server DB instances use SQL Server Database Mirroring (DBM).

    Reference:

options: There is no guessing on capacity needs.
question.explanation:

question.questionText:
A company's web application currently has tight dependencies on underlying components, so when one component fails the entire web application fails.
Applying which AWS Cloud design principle will address the current design issue?
options: Implementing elasticity, enabling the application to scale up or scale down as demand changes.
Enabling several EC2 instances to run in parallel to achieve better performance.
Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components fail.
Doubling EC2 computing resources to increase system fault tolerance.
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components fail.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: To minimizes downtime and data loss from natural catastrophes, application failures, or disruptions of service, which AWS service would you use?
question.explanation: AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery is an AWS service that helps you minimizes downtime and data loss from natural catastrophes, application failures, or disruptions of service. This service is part of the storage category and is essential for understanding AWS cloud services in the technology domain.

question.questionText: Which AWS service provides a self-service portal for on-demand access to AWS compliance reports?
question.explanation:
- AWS Artifact is your go-to, central resource for compliance-related information that matters to you.
    - It provides on-demand access to AWS' security and compliance reports and select online agreements.
    - Reports available in AWS Artifact include our Service Organization Control (SOC) reports, Payment Card Industry (PCI) reports, and certifications from accreditation bodies across geographies and compliance verticals that validate the implementation and operating effectiveness of AWS security controls.
    - Agreements available in AWS Artifact include the Business Associate Addendum (BAA) and the Nondisclosure Agreement (NDA).

    Reference:

question.explanation: The correct answer is: AWS Artifact.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which of the following is an important architectural principle when designing cloud applications?
options: Store data and backups in the same region.
question.explanation:
- There are six design principles for operational excellence in the cloud:
      - Perform operations as code
      - Annotate documentation
      - Make frequent, small, reversible changes
      - Refine operations procedures frequently
      - Anticipate failure
      - Learn from all operational failures

    Reference:

question.questionText: Which AWS IAM feature is used to associate a set of permissions with multiple users?

    - For example, you could have a group called Admins and give that group the types of permissions that administrators typically need.

    Reference:

Petabyte-scale data warehouse with automatically provisioned resources and intelligent scaling

question.questionText: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Select TWO)
question.explanation: The correct answers are: Performance efficiency. and Security.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which AWS service should you use to create and manage catalogs of IT services that are approved for AWS?
question.explanation: AWS Service Catalog is an AWS service that helps you create and manage catalogs of IT services that are approved for AWS. This service is part of the management and governance category and is essential for understanding AWS cloud services in the cloud-concepts domain.

question.questionText: Which of the Reserved Instance (RI) pricing models can change the attributes of the RI as long as the exchange results in the creation of RIs of equal or greater value?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Convertible RIs.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which of the following helps a customer view the Amazon EC2 billing activity for the past month?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: AWS Cost & Usage Reports.. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which AWS feature will reduce the customer's total cost of ownership (TCO)?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Elastic computing. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/

question.questionText: Which of the following AWS Cloud services can be used to run a customer-managed relational database?
question.explanation: The correct answer is: Amazon EC2. For more details, please refer to the AWS documentation at https://aws.amazon.com/certification/certified-cloud-practitioner/
